With the release of Bootstrap 5.3, new features for working with shadows and depth have been introduced. This documentation will guide you through the process of using these features effectively. ### Objective and Scope The objective of this documentation is to explain how to utilize the new shadow and depth features in Bootstrap 5.3. It will cover the necessary requirements, provide step-by-step instructions, and offer best practices and recommendations for optimal usage. ### Requirements and Pre-requisites To work with shadows and depth in Bootstrap 5.3, you will need the following: - Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS - Bootstrap 5.3 installed in your project ### Step-by-Step Instructions Follow these steps to use shadows and depth in Bootstrap 5.3: 1. Start by creating a new HTML file or open an existing one in your preferred text editor. 2. Include the Bootstrap CSS and JavaScript files in your HTML file. Bootstrap provides several classes for different shadow styles, such as `shadow-sm`, `shadow-lg`, and `shadow-none`. Experiment with these classes to achieve the desired effect. 6.
